bug.short_desc: There is a bug.

long_desc.thetext: The system has a bug.

bug.short_desc: ChequeJFrame - Do not verify the e-Cheque

long_desc.thetext:
Steps:
1. Create an e-Cheque and save it. 2. Open the same cheque 3. Select verify 4. Select Security Tools 5. Choose your *DigCert.edc
The "The signature is not valid" message will pop up.
Even though it is your cheque (because you just created it) it says it is not valid.
Investigating further, this is actually a bug in DigitalSignature.java. Basically, it's returning !verify instead of verify, therefore causing correct signatures to be incorrect and vice versa.

bug.short_desc: RegistrationJFrame - Does not create folders inside a folder

long_desc.thetext:
Five folders are created with the name of PreviousFolder\\ThisFolder, instead of being created inside the PreviousFolder.
e.g. (seng426\\History instead of seng426/History. The second being History inside seng426 folder).

bug.short_desc: jordan test entry

long_desc.thetext: here is some description of the steps to reproduce the bug
Nah, he is lying... There was no such thing as bug =P
adding Orig. Est. Hours worked and so on

bug.short_desc: client : formatting and spacing issues in all *.java files

long_desc.thetext: Formatting and spacing issues occur in all files. Apply the java coding conventions: 1. spacing(tabs) 2. formatting (indentation) 3. placement of curly braces.
applied auto formatting to all files.

bug.short_desc: EChqeue.java line 106 - This comment is unecessary

long_desc.thetext: comment "to extracting data we use get functions" should be removed
Comment removed

bug.short_desc: ECheque.java line 37 - This comment is in the wrong place, and is unnecessary

long_desc.thetext: Remove comment "to ener data we use set function"
Comment removed

bug.short_desc: EChequeIO.java, line * - EChequeIO functions should be incorporated into ECheque

long_desc.thetext: Combine EChequeIO with ECheque. Current use of EChequeIO is as a "method class"
Existence is no longer a thing
Existence is no longer a thing

bug.short_desc: EChequeIO.java line 23,32 - The ‘new file’ portion of the variable declaration is unnecessary, since fileOutputStream can take a filepath

long_desc.thetext: before: new FileOutputStream(new File(filename)); after: new FileOutputStream(filename);
Fixed after merge with ECheque

bug.short_desc: EChequeRegistration.java line *- Class is spelled incorrectly

long_desc.thetext: EChequeRegisteration -> EChequeRegistration

bug.short_desc: EChequeRegistration.java- Function name is spelt incorrectly

long_desc.thetext: lines 58,78,86 function names are incorrectly spelt. setPasword() getEWalletLoaction() getPasword()

bug.short_desc: EChqueserver.java - Name of class is spelt incorrectly

long_desc.thetext: EChqueserver -> EChequeServer Will require re-factoring all occurences of EChqueserver
Renamed the file and all references.

bug.short_desc: Client - clean up imports on all java files.

long_desc.thetext: Look through all java files and remove unused imports.

bug.short_desc: EChqueserver.java- Doesn’t meet naming conventions (should be cert, not cerit)

long_desc.thetext: line 39,47,75,79,80 User "cert" as the variable name instead of "cerit"
Fixed.. by someone

bug.short_desc: EChequeClient.java - Functions start with a capital letter (convention is lowercase)

long_desc.thetext: Method names should start with lower case instead of capital. May require refactoring in many .java files. Make use of IDE refactoring tools.

bug.short_desc: EChequeClient.java- Variable is unused

long_desc.thetext:
lines 43,49 variables "walletPath" and "getProcessConnection" are never used in the program. They are also private and do have any accessor methods.
recommendation: Remove from the class.

bug.short_desc: EChequeClient.java - Constructors are similar; should have documentation

long_desc.thetext: lines 53-86 Multiple constructors. Document usage of each constructor, because each constructor is used to initialize the EChequeClient for a different task/role.

bug.short_desc: EChequeClient.java - Create an enum to denote "mode"

long_desc.thetext: lines 53,68,79 Mode should be an enum, since it can take on only a few, specific values. bankmode is used in the processBankConnection()

bug.short_desc: EChequeClient.java - document processConnection and processBankConnection methods

long_desc.thetext: lines 106,164 document processConnection and processBankConnection should have documentation explaining their functionality and their differences.

bug.short_desc: EChequeClient.java- client ignores any error messages from server

long_desc.thetext:
lines 106,164 Server may send error messages, but the client ignores them.
1. The client opens the connection 2. client sends data over the socket. 3. client does not check for any return input from the server. It just closes the socket connection.
Appears to be working as intended.

bug.short_desc: EChequeClient.java - Cheque is neither encrypted by this function, nor encrypted by EChequeIO

long_desc.thetext: line 120 Cheque is neither encrypted by this function, nor encrypted by EChequeIO

bug.short_desc: EChequeClient - document differences between bankmodes.

long_desc.thetext: lines 172,183,191 No documentation for the differences between bank modes. bankmode is only used in the processBankConnection() method. It is passed to the server, which then tells the server what kind of connection the client wishes to establish.
Now using self-documenting static variables.

bug.short_desc: EChequeClient - break up logic used in code segment ( lines 204-219)

long_desc.thetext: lines 204-219 Code should be broken up into two blocks based on the value of bankConnection, rather than many if statements throughout
Tracing code appeared to be for debug purposes, removed it entirely.

bug.short_desc: EChequeClient -Spelling mistakes in the statements to be printed

long_desc.thetext: lines 206-215 Spelling mistakes in the statements to be printed
Printed messages have been removed entirely

bug.short_desc: EChequeClient - The same error message is thrown for all possible exceptions

long_desc.thetext:
lines 224 The same error message is thrown for all possible exceptions. The catch statement will catch an "Exception" but processConnection() and processBankConnection() can throw exceptions of types IOException,ClassNotFoundException,NoSuchAlgorithmException, NoSuchPaddingException.
The error message that is printed does not extract the specific cause of the exception.

bug.short_desc: AESCrypt - Functions do not have any documentation

long_desc.thetext: Documented each function

bug.short_desc: AESCrypt - Mode is an integer, but should be an enum since it can take only 4 values

long_desc.thetext:
line 34 Mode is an integer, but should be an enum since it can take only 4 values. mode value is used to determine both the cipherMode and the cipherInstance.
0 -> Cipher.ENCRYPT_MODE, AES 1 -> Cipher.DECRYPTE_MODE, AES 2 -> Cipher.WRAP_MODE, RSA 3,* -> Cipher.UNWRAP_MODE, RSA
Switched to enum, function now throws an Exception if mode is incorrect
*** Bug 214 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

bug.short_desc: AESCrypt - For any mode value greater than 3 will default to UNWRAP mode.

long_desc.thetext: line 44 Default value to UNWRAP mode. This should be specified, or code should throw an exception on a 1 different value

Exception added to handle this issue
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of bug 213 ***

bug.short_desc: DigitalCertificate.java - Variable names should begin with a lowercase letter

long_desc.thetext: All variables but "publicKey" begin with uppercase letter, as opposed as what it's stated in code java conventions.

bug.short_desc: DigitalCertificateIO.java - Functionality should be incorporated into DigitalCertificate.java

long_desc.thetext:
Combine DigitalCertificateIO.java with DigitalCertificate.java. Current use of DigitalCertificateIO is as a "method class".
(Same problem as Bug 193, but with different files)
Successfully refactored into DigitalCertificate

bug.short_desc: DigitalSigneture.java - Name of class and function are spelled incorrectly

long_desc.thetext: DigitalSigneture.java -> DigitalSignature.java Will require re-factoring all occurences of DigitalSigneture
In DigitalSigneture.java: Line 25: Function name is spelled incorreectly (signeture -> signature). Need refactorization on it (class ChequeJFrame.java uses this function).

bug.short_desc: DigitalSigneture.java - Comments are spelled incorrectly

long_desc.thetext: A couple of words are misspelled in the comment. Line 34: verifay -> verify, and algorthem -> algorithm

bug.short_desc: DigitalSigneture.java - Poor variable naming

long_desc.thetext: Line 39: veryMessage is not a good name for a variable. It is not meaningful and does not say what it do.

bug.short_desc: DigitalSigneture.java - Security issue with string

long_desc.thetext: Line 39: Number of bytes for a certificate is not guaranteed to be the length of the string.

bug.short_desc: ChequeJFrame.java - Password checking should be handled elsewhere

long_desc.thetext: Line 532: Password checking is used in multiple places. It is advised to create a method in an Util Class to check the password.
Fixed. The password padding function has now been moved to a static method in AESCrypt

bug.short_desc: ChequeJFrame line 577-655 Inefficient/poor coding

long_desc.thetext:
Nested if-else statements should be converted into non-nested ifs.
i.e. if(x){ if(y){ if(z){ if(w){ code_segment_1 else code_segment_2 return var else code_segment_3 return var else code_segment_4 return var else code_segment_5 return var
return var
converted to
if (!x) code_segment_5 return var if (!y) code_segment_4 return var if (!z) code_segment_3 return var if (!w) code_segment_2 return var
code_segment_1 return var

bug.short_desc: ChequeJFrame line 753 Spelling mistake in function name

long_desc.thetext:
private String getFileLoaction(String dialogTitle)
getFileLoaction should be refactored into getFileLocation

bug.short_desc: ChequeJFrame granteed checkbox has no functionality

long_desc.thetext: Functionality needs to be implemented for the granteed checkbox.
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of bug 240 ***

bug.short_desc: ChequeJFrame Granteed button does not specify functionality

long_desc.thetext:
The Granteed checkbox does not have any indicators as to what it is supposed to do. The checkbox's label may be misspelt as well (It may be that it is supposed to say 'Guaranteed').
If the spelling of the label is correct, a tooltip should be added.
*** Bug 239 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

bug.short_desc: ElectronicChequeJFrame.java Incorrectly spelt variable name.

long_desc.thetext: The variable registerdUser should be changed to registeredUser and usages should be refactored.

bug.short_desc: ElectronicChequeJFrame.java line 290 Inefficient/poor coding practices

long_desc.thetext: Fixed.

bug.short_desc: ElectronicChequeJFrame line 329 password checking code is used in multiple functions. Should be combined.

long_desc.thetext:
See http://bugzilla.seng.uvic.ca/show_bug.cgi?id=236
Password checking is used in multiple places. It is advised to create a method in an Util Class to check the password.
Leave it how it is. I think it's fine.

bug.short_desc: receiveChequeJFrame line 195,198

long_desc.thetext:
Exceptions are not handled. Proper code should be added so that exceptions are acknowledged, and dealt with instead of ignored.
If behaviour is intended, code should be commented to explain why it is not necessary to handle exceptions

bug.short_desc: Todo comments left for implemented code (client side)

long_desc.thetext: Remove comments after ensuring todos are gone
are done*

bug.short_desc: ReceiveChequeJFrame.java - Variable names spelt incorrectly

long_desc.thetext: line 28 - serverStartFlage

bug.short_desc: SendChequeJFrame.java - Many features unimplemented

long_desc.thetext: implement unimplemented features (ie. Attach cheque, zip cheque,timeout)
Fix in next version.

bug.short_desc: Fields are unclear

long_desc.thetext: Fields do not imply what they should be filled with (usability issue). URL/IP field actually expects FQDN/IP
Added a tooltip text to explain the requirements. If this is insufficient, then we can re-open and change the labels.

bug.short_desc: RegistrationJFrame.java lines 459-469 - Certificate is not signed

long_desc.thetext: Make sure certificate is signed.
This line was already here to sign the cert dcObj.setPublicKey(RSAKeys.getPublic());

bug.short_desc: RegistrationJFrame.java lines 379-535 - too many nested if-elses

long_desc.thetext: The nested if-elses should be extracted and turned into a series of ifs which print error messages then exit out

bug.short_desc: ReceiveChequeJFrame.java - Features are unimplemented (timeout)

long_desc.thetext: some features are unimplemented. timeout - checkbox is unused. unzip cheque button is unimplemented.
Leave for next revision.

bug.short_desc: RegistrationJFrame.java - java path separator should be used.

long_desc.thetext: lines 337-350 Java path separator should be used instead of strong concatenation

bug.short_desc: AESCrypt - Blocking is confusing

long_desc.thetext:
Line 49
Block is confusing; should be checking cipherMode in the if statement, or should be documented
Changed mode to an enum which contains Cypher types

bug.short_desc: AESCrypt - Exceptions throws not documented

long_desc.thetext:
Line 59
Function should be more specific about what types of exceptions it throws
Added GeneralSecurityExceptions to handle security, and IOExceptions for file IO

bug.short_desc: RegistrationJFrame.java lines 337-350

long_desc.thetext: File class may throw IOExceptions, which are neither properly checked nor handled. These lines should be put into a try/catch block and handled.

bug.short_desc: Unsafe socket operations

long_desc.thetext: Try-catch blocks do not catch all possible exceptions, and in many cases do not handle them correctly.
I think these are all fixed... good enough anyway.

bug.short_desc: Sanitize inputs to methods and setters

long_desc.thetext: Many methods do not sanitize inputs and setters. this can either be resolved by providing documentation on correct call procedure, or by coding in specific sanitizing checks.

bug.short_desc: Sanitize form fields.

long_desc.thetext: Not all fields in the forms ( Registration, e-Cheque send/receive/creation ) receive proper sanitization.
Done for EBankingJFrame

bug.short_desc: Wallet configuration

long_desc.thetext: E-Wallet creation and configuration requires work. Path-seperators. Default path location. Hard-code path names should be removed, provide an interface. Validation on inputs.

bug.short_desc: Use different ports for client-bank and client-client connection

long_desc.thetext: Ports used for client-bank and client-client connection is hard-coded to 8189.

bug.short_desc: Handle passwords with more than 16 characters

long_desc.thetext: Currently the application will throw an exception, and then show an error dialog to the user. There should be no such restriction ( or at least > 16 characters)
Passwords with more than 16 characters are truncated and only the first 16 characters are used. There is now a helper method inside the AESCrypte, which pads any password not long enough.

bug.short_desc: General GUI redesign and improvement.

long_desc.thetext: Login page - no indication if it is unavailable Hide the interface buttons, or give them a disabled look if they are not active. Add labels to all buttons. Provide better tool-tips to all interface elements.

bug.short_desc: Invalid cheque's can be saved

long_desc.thetext: Entering an invalid date or money and then saving a cheque saves the incorrect data to the cheque file.

bug.short_desc: Exit menu item does not close ChequeJFrame
Digital Certificate Corrupted spelt incorrectly in verify cheque in EChequeJFrame

long_desc.thetext: To reproduce, try to load an invalid certificate when verifying a signature. Error message is mispelt

bug.short_desc: ElectronicChequeJFrame.java -Using the enter key does not activate any of the buttons.

long_desc.thetext: This is a user usability issue. Currently only mouse-clicks will activate the buttons. It would be nice if the application can also capture key-presses for activating the buttons.

bug.short_desc: EChequeClient.java RunClient function is public, but only used internally.

long_desc.thetext: RunClient function is unnecessarily public.

bug.short_desc: EChequeServer if statement is always true

long_desc.thetext: If(!sessionDone) will always be true, since sessionDone is defined immediately above.

bug.short_desc: EchequeServer function names do not match convention

long_desc.thetext: Many function names begin with a capital letter

bug.short_desc: EchequeServer Scope of RunServer is public, should be private

long_desc.thetext: RunServer should be changed to private, since it is only used internally.

bug.short_desc: EBankingJFrame - separate buttons for Cancel and Deposit cheque

long_desc.thetext:
Instead of using checkmarks for cancel/deposit, simply have two different buttons which enable when all information required has been entered.
Buttons are not enabled when: no check loaded, or no hostname entered

bug.short_desc: EChequeServer - proper exception handling

long_desc.thetext: Deal with each exception type individually and properly.
Exceptions are now handled with error messages being thrown.

bug.short_desc: Config.epc file should be deleted if the registration fails.

long_desc.thetext: Config.epc is written out to disk regardless of the registration was successful or not. We should delete this file, or not write to disc until we receive confirmation from the server that the user has been successfully created.

bug.short_desc: After registration, user should be immediately be able to login

long_desc.thetext: After a user has successfully registered, they are required to close the application before the login panel is 'enabled' for them to login.

bug.short_desc: Bank doesn'

long_desc.thetext: This isn't anything

bug.short_desc: Registration doesn't accept url type ***.com

long_desc.thetext:
Now accepts
***.com, ***.org, ***.ca *.*.*.* localhost

bug.short_desc: Recieving a cheque can not be verified - EOFException thrown when reading cheque

long_desc.thetext: Reieve a cheque, it will crash with the above exception.

bug.short_desc: Corrupting private key allows access to users cheques

long_desc.thetext: 1. Corrupt the private key (save a backup) 2. Configure the account for a new user 3. Drag the backed-up private key into the new e-wallet 4. You can now use the other users stuff without their password

bug.short_desc: Registration - Error message for name length too long is unclear

long_desc.thetext: If the name is too long we do not validate the size before registering
Fix in next version.

bug.short_desc: ChequeJFrame - can enter negative amounts

long_desc.thetext: 1. Enter a negative amount into the field 2. Save cheque 3. Cheque is saved with incorrect amount
Fix in next revision

bug.short_desc: Deposit and cancel do not work properly
EChequeDB - Exception if ebank.account table doesn't exist but still success message for registration

long_desc.thetext:
Figure out what's going on - is the account table made, and if so then don't print out the exception but rather deal with appropriately (can print out warning if wanted)
To test - try registering and see what happens.

bug.short_desc: EChqueserver.java - refactor ChequeReferenceString to ECheque object

long_desc.thetext: line 200 ChequeReferenceString should be a function on the Echeque object, since it is used in many places throughout the program

bug.short_desc: EChequeServer.java lines * - Vulnerable to sql injection

long_desc.thetext: Fix vulnerability; check input.

bug.short_desc: EChequeServer.java lines * - Spelling mistakes and poor error messages

long_desc.thetext: Fix spelling mistakes and make error messages more informative.

bug.short_desc: EChequeServer.java lines 40-47 - Commented lines should be removed

long_desc.thetext: See subject.

bug.short_desc: EChequeServer.java line 60 - unneeded variable

long_desc.thetext: Variable can be removed, as it only holds the value ‘false’

bug.short_desc: EChequeServer.java line 61 - Variable is unused

long_desc.thetext: See summary.

bug.short_desc: Echqueserver.java line 86 - Poor variable naming.

long_desc.thetext: Variable should be named ‘certificate’ ‘cert’ or ‘digitalcert’

(In reply to Morgan McKenzie from comment #0) > Variable should be named ‘certificate’ ‘cert’ or ‘digitalcert’
Current variable name: clientCerit

bug.short_desc: EChequeServer.java line 96 - return value never checked

long_desc.thetext: Return value of runDB() never checked; result of operation unknown

bug.short_desc: EChequeDB.java line 122 - return values better way

long_desc.thetext: This is a hack to have two values returned. This should be done by exceptions, or using object Doubles.

bug.short_desc: EChequeServer.java line 199 - Poor exception handling

long_desc.thetext: Exception should be more specific and should have better handling

bug.short_desc: EChequeServer.java line 228 - extended string concatenation

long_desc.thetext: Large amount of string concatenation; string builder should be used instead

bug.short_desc: EChequeDB.java lines 87, 164 Almost Duplicate Functions

long_desc.thetext: Functions should have different names since they do slightly different things, or should or should be merged

bug.short_desc: EchequeDB.java lines 120 - Array used to return values

long_desc.thetext: Using an array to return a second variable is ill advised. The class Double should be used instead or implementation should be figured out so that doesn't need second return.
Fix is not possible as the double object is immutable.

bug.short_desc: EchequeDB.java line 57,61,87 - error messages are removed

long_desc.thetext: Commented out messages should be put back in or removed completely
Completed by removing comments

bug.short_desc: EchequeDB.java line 113,157,199 - Extraneous code

long_desc.thetext: Block should be reduced to ‘return flag’

bug.short_desc: DigitalSigneture.java - Unecessary lines of code, block of code should be condensed

long_desc.thetext: Lines 42 to 48: Block should be condensed to "return !veryMessage.verify(messagesign));

bug.short_desc: EBankingJFrame lines 198-211 poor/inefficient coding practices

long_desc.thetext:
Nested if-else statements should be converted into non-nested ifs.
i.e. if(x){ if(y){ if(z){ if(w){ code_segment_1 else code_segment_2 return var else code_segment_3 return var else code_segment_4 return var else code_segment_5 return var
return var
converted to
if (!x) code_segment_5 return var if (!y) code_segment_4 return var if (!z) code_segment_3 return var if (!w) code_segment_2 return var

bug.short_desc: DigitalCertificateIO line 0 - Missing class header

long_desc.thetext: Add a class header.
Class is removed

bug.short_desc: DigitalCertificateIO line 7 - SaveDC name inconsistent

long_desc.thetext: SaveDC name is inconsistent, since ‘digitalCertificate’ is used everywhere else. Should rename it to use this.
Naming is refactored to saveDigitalCertificate when it was moved to DigitalCertificate.java

bug.short_desc: DigitalCertificateIO line 9 Comment unnecessary

long_desc.thetext: Comment makes no sense and is unnecessary - remove it or make it useful.
Comment removed when DigitalCertificateIO was
Comment was removed with the class

bug.short_desc: DigitalCertificateIO line 10,18 - Name file portion is unnecessary

long_desc.thetext: The ‘new file’ portion of the variable declaration is unnecessary, since fileOutputStream can take a filepath

bug.short_desc: DigitalCertificateIO line 16 - The file fan also throw a ClassCastException

long_desc.thetext: Add handling for ClassCastException.

bug.short_desc: DigitalCertificateIO line 27 - Comment is incorrect

long_desc.thetext: Comment is incorrect, the function creates a new instance of DigitalCertificateIO
Removed when the class was removed

bug.short_desc: DigitalCertificateIO line 28 - Constructors placement incorrect

long_desc.thetext: Constructors should be at the top of the class, by convention
Removed with class refactoring

bug.short_desc: BankSever.java - Class name is spelt incorrectly

long_desc.thetext: Fix spelling.

bug.short_desc: EchequeBankServer.java line 137 - The exception it not dealt with.

long_desc.thetext: Deal with exception safely and suitably.

bug.short_desc: EchequeBankServer.java lines 142,147,162 - messages not useful

long_desc.thetext: The messages are not useful and may be misleading; fix so not misleading and useful, or remove.

bug.short_desc: EChequeBankServer.java line 134 - thread cleanup done inproperly

long_desc.thetext: 5000ms may not be enough time for the thread to finish cleaning up. This should be done through a callback or state checking.
Added a volatile flag variable to end the thread.

bug.short_desc: EChequeDB.java line 46 - Class loaded using reflection with no error checking

long_desc.thetext: Add proper error checking after class creation.
The method throws the classNotFoundException, its user-beware.

bug.short_desc: Todo comments left for implemented code (server side)

long_desc.thetext: Remove comments after ensuring todos are done

bug.short_desc: Change database configuration

long_desc.thetext: Database url and configuration parameters are hard-coded. userName,password, JDBC_DRIVER, DATABASE_URL
Fixed. database_url,userName, and password fields are now being read-in from an external file called 'db.config'

bug.short_desc: Many error dialog's are being shown by the server.

long_desc.thetext: Server side code should not be throwing alert-dialogs. They should be handled and logged, and if necessary shut-down the server.

bug.short_desc: Design a new "create E-cheque" GUI

long_desc.thetext: Current GUI is not-intuitive. Menu-bar does not "look" like a menu bar, and the options do not look like options. Overall work-flow is also confusing. First one must create a cheque, Load cheque, and then save, these are are done through the menu options. It is better to place this functionality directly on the GUI.

bug.short_desc: EChequeBankServer.java - Pressing stop the server also closed the application.

long_desc.thetext: This may be unexpected by some users. It may be better to just stop the server, but leave the GUI/application open.
This is to be left as is.

bug.short_desc: EBankingJFrame - getChequeLoaction spelt wrong and should be before methods that use it
EBankingJFrame - Cheque not shown as loaded

long_desc.thetext: Make indicator that cheque has been loaded.

bug.short_desc: EChequeServer - runServer function is not needed

long_desc.thetext: Put body of runServer into the run function.

bug.short_desc: DB Connections Broken

long_desc.thetext: All database connections fail, throwing exceptions.

bug.short_desc: EChequeRegistration.java - Default registered account initialized with a balance of 10000
Short Password generates exception

long_desc.thetext: Entering 4 character password causes exception. Instead should pop up with message stating either just invalid password or that the password must be at least 8 characters.

bug.short_desc: Closing bank server with [x] restarts the server instead of exiting

long_desc.thetext: 1. Click on the x at the top right 2. Server will restart itself

bug.short_desc: DB Configuration appears to only allow cancelling a cheque after it is deposited.

long_desc.thetext: Nothing to do with our code, but rather the database constraints.
Seems wrong but I'm going to leave it.
